data.title: Failed to build cocos2d-x on x64 due to error C2065: 'GWL_WNDPROC': undeclared identifier
data.body:
We tried to build cocos2d-x on Windows with VS2015 Update 3. It failed to build on x64 due to the error C2065: 'GWL_WNDPROC': undeclared identifier. 'GWL_WNDPROC' is defined in C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.14393.0\um\WinUser.h like below. But if _WIN64 is defined. 'GWL_WNDPROC' will be undefined. So error C2065 is reported when build on x64. Could you please take a look at this issue? Thanks in advance!
WinUser.h
**#define GWL_WNDPROC         (-4)**
#define GWL_HINSTANCE       (-6)
#define GWL_HWNDPARENT      (-8)
#define GWL_STYLE           (-16)
#define GWL_EXSTYLE         (-20)
**#define GWL_USERDATA        (-21)**
#define GWL_ID              (-12)

**#ifdef _WIN64**
**#undef GWL_WNDPROC**
#undef GWL_HINSTANCE
#undef GWL_HWNDPARENT
**#undef GWL_USERDATA**
#endif /* _WIN64 */

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. git clone https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x.git D:\Cocos2dx\src
2. Open a VS 2015 command prompt and browse to D:\Cocos2dx
3. mkdir build_x64 && pushd build_x64
4. cmake -G "Visual Studio 14 Win64" -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION=10.0.14393.0 ..\src
5. popd
6. msbuild /m /p:Configuration=Release;Platform=x64 build_x64\Cocos2d-X.sln /t:Rebuild

**Actual result:**
D:\Cocos2dx\src\cocos\ui\UIEditBox\UIEditBoxImpl-win32.cpp(64): **error C2065: 'GWL_WNDPROC': undeclared identifier** [D:\Cocos2dx\build_x64\cocos\cocos2dInternal.vcxproj]
         D:\Cocos2dx\src\cocos\ui\UIEditBox\UIEditBoxImpl-win32.cpp(103): error C2065: 'GWL_WNDPROC': undeclared identifier [D:\Cocos2dx\build_x64\cocos\cocos2dInternal.vcxproj]
         D:\Cocos2dx\src\cocos\ui\UIEditBox\UIEditBoxImpl-win32.cpp(130): **error C2065: 'GWL_USERDATA': undeclared identifier** [D:\Cocos2dx\build_x64\cocos\cocos2dInternal.vcxproj]
         D:\Cocos2dx\src\cocos\ui\UIEditBox\UIEditBoxImpl-win32.cpp(131): error C2065: 'GWL_WNDPROC': undeclared identifier [D:\Cocos2dx\build_x64\cocos\cocos2dInternal.vcxproj]
         D:\Cocos2dx\src\cocos\ui\UIEditBox\UIEditBoxImpl-win32.cpp(159): error C2065: 'GWL_USERDATA': undeclared identifier [D:\Cocos2dx\build_x64\cocos\cocos2dInternal.vcxproj]
         D:\Cocos2dx\src\cocos\ui\UIEditBox\UIEditBoxImpl-win32.cpp(160): error C2065: 'GWL_WNDPROC': undeclared identifier [D:\Cocos2dx\build_x64\cocos\cocos2dInternal.vcxproj]

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
gradle configuration issue
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15

`PROP_TARGET_SDK_VERSION` is used for `APP_PLATFORM` and `targetSdkVersion`. They are different, so should use another variable for `APP_PLATFORM`. 

Corresponding forum issue is [here](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocos2d-x-3-15-wrong-logic-in-android-gradle-causing-critical-bug/36877).

data.title: Call 'update' method in 'stop/stopAll' to cleanup immediately
data.body: Since AudioEngineImp uses schedule to remove unused audio players, schedule may be cancelled by `Scheduler::unscheduleAll`, `AudioPlayer`s will not be released for ever.

milestone.description: add optimization codes for Huawei devices

data.title: Fixing serious XMLHTTP leak when CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS enabled
data.body:
Fixing issue where XMLHttpRequests would not have their destruction fire if CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS was set. This will cause the entire XMLHttpRequest to leak, including the **entire data payload** on the XMLHttpRequest. If your game makes a lot of these requests, it can add up very quickly. 

This is being caused by an improper rooting strategy. Basically, we are rooting the callbacks of the XMLHttpRequest, and unrooting them when ~MinXMLHttpRequest() fires. _HOWEVER_, ~MinXMLHttpRequest won't fire, because the GC will never clean up the XMLHttpRequest, because it's callback's are rooted, and these callbacks usually reference the XMLHttpRequest, creating a reference cycle. 

Since the callbacks are rooted, and usually reference the XMLHttpRequest, the GC won't see the XMLHttpRequest as garbage and won't clean it up.

The way I've chosen to fix this is to unroot ALL callbacks once certain event's have happened. For example, once the request is complete, I will unroot all pending callbacks.

This required some changes to the root and unroot functions in cocos2d_specifics. The unroot function didn't work, because 

- The root function will add a reference to jsb._root, but the unroot function attempts to remove references from jsb.jsb._root, which fails
- The unroot function also won't unroot anything that don't have a proxy from jsb_get_js_proxy, even though you can root things without a js proxy in the add root function. 

I can reproduce this issue in cocos2d-x-lite, and was also to reproduce it as in issue in a cocos creator made app. I view this as critical for cocos2d-x-lite and cocos creator, as CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS is enabled by default in that version of the engine. I was able to reproduce this on iOS and win32. 

**REPRODUCTION STEPS**
With CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS set to 1 in ccConfig.h, In XHRTest.js, add a call to cc.sys.garbageCollect(); to onEnter;
Run the test multiple times, notice that ~MinXMLHttpRequest never fires
apply this patch
Repeat the above action, notice that the destructor will fire. 

@pandamicro @minggo

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Sound in new AudioEngine won't loop
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1 with 3.15 audio engine
- devices test on: Nexus 6P with Android 7.1.1
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version: n/a
   - VS version: n/a
   - browser type and version: n/a

So, I was using 3.14.1 with some adjustments and new audio engine. Lastly I've updated audio directory from 3.15 and now sound won't loop:

`soundId = cocos2d::experimental::AudioEngine::play2d(filename, true);`

Plays only once. It causes extra problems: when I'm trying to stop soundId after first loop (so it's not playing as it should) app would crash.

data.title: Uses better configuration for huawei optimization
AudioEngine::preload crash occasionally when preload ogg file
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.15
- devices test on: Samsung Galaxy Tab A, Samsung Galaxy J7
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: - (Android Studio)
   - browser type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Play ogg file or preload ogg file

it happen rarely and on random file, so i tried preload all files (130 files) at splash screen, crash rate is 25%.
switched to simpleaudioengine, no more crash.

Crash log only show SIGSEGV invalid memory access (segmentation fault) error. but i dig and put additional log and it crashed on two different places each time crash:
-AudioDecoderOgg.cpp line 70 : ov_open_callbacks
leads to vorbisfile.c : _ov_open1, error is arround here
-AudioDecoderOgg.cpp before line 121 : ov_clear

data.title: fixed #17835: pauseEventListenersForTarget doesn't work correctly while in dispatching event
data.body: fix https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17835

data.title: pauseEventListenersForTarget doesn't work correctly while in dispatching event
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.15
- devices test on: mac
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 
   - Xcode version: 8.3.2
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a MenuItemFont and a sprite and add them to scene
2. Create EventListenerTouchOneByOne in MenuItemFont's callback and addEventListenerWithSceneGraphPriority(listener, sprite), then pauseEventListenersTarget(sprite)
3. The sprite is still touchable.

Expected:
The sprite isn't touchable since the listener was paused by user's code.

data.title: Webview opacity and background transparency
data.body:
1.- Added the possibility of being able to change the opacity of the webviews in android and ios.
2.- Also added the possibilito of being able to set the background fully transparent.

I have done the tests, so u can try it. You can find it in Node:UI->webviewUI. There are 2 new buttons.

Refactoring editbox and  system label on win32 platform

EditBox doesn't popup a window for input, it uses the native edit ctrl to input. 

This PR also fix the system label overflow issue on windows.
